entry.title: Armenian banks begin blocking Russian transactions for electronics: Business Week Armenia

media:group.media:title: Armenian banks begin blocking Russian transactions for electronics: Business Week Armenia
media:group.media:description:
In this week‚Äôs edition of CivilNet‚Äôs business digest:
üìçArmenia‚Äôs inflation rate fell sharply from 3.2% to 1.3% last month, but the Central Bank has so far given no indications it plans to cut interest rates. üìçA number of Armenian banks have started blocking Russian firms from making payments for electronics imports. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Team Telecom will become the country‚Äôs first mobile network operator to go public.

entry.title: ‚ÄúWe are living in hell, 25% of our Armenian Quarter is gone‚Äù - PART 1

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúWe are living in hell, 25% of our Armenian Quarter is gone‚Äù - PART 1
media:group.media:description:
As CivilNet continues its coverage of the Cows‚Äô Garden or Goveru Bardez issue in Jerusalem, we unpack this complex issue and the protest movement that started, after it came to light that 25% of the quarter has been leased off for 99 years. Stay tuned for part two where we look at why the Cows‚Äô Garden issue is also being opposed by Palestinian, Jordanian, Greek and Jewish voices.

entry.title: Court finds woman guilty of attempting to kidnap prime minister‚Äôs son

media:group.media:title: Court finds woman guilty of attempting to kidnap prime minister‚Äôs son
media:group.media:description:
üìçTwo U.S. senators have introduced a resolution condemning Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh, now approaching its sixth month. üìçA State Department spokesperson declined to say when a high-level Armenia-Azerbaijan summit in Washington, initially set for next week but then postponed, may take place. üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan will meet today with Russian President Vladimir Putin. üìçA Yerevan court found Gayane Hakobyan guilty of trying to kidnap Pashinyan‚Äôs son, but released her from detention on a four-year suspended sentence.

entry.title: Russia is becoming hostage to Turkey and Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Russia is becoming hostage to Turkey and Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
Georgi Derluguian, Professor of Historical Sociology at New York University Abu Dhabi, sits down with CivilNet Editor-in-Chief Karen Harutyunyan to talk about recent developments in Armenia‚Äôs wider geopolitical region and their repercussions in the South Caucasus.

entry.title: Armenia-Azerbaijan summit in Washington postponed by Baku

media:group.media:title: Armenia-Azerbaijan summit in Washington postponed by Baku
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijan has provided information to the European Court of Human Rights on the two Armenian servicemen allegedly abducted last month. üìçArmenian foreign minister and newly elected Turkish foreign minister held their first phone call to discuss normalization efforts and ongoing peace negotiations. üìçA planned meeting of the Armenian and Azerbaijani foreign ministers in Washington has been postponed at Azerbaijan's request.

entry.title: Celebrating 100 episodes of Insights with Eric Hacopian

media:group.media:title: Celebrating 100 episodes of Insights with Eric Hacopian
media:group.media:description:
As we mark the 100 episode of Insights with Eric Hacopian, Eric and the team would like to thank all our viewers for joining us on this journey. In this special episode, we are doing something a little different: Eric answers some of your most pressing questions.
Stay tuned for the next 100 episodes of Insights.
